modules.description: Provides thread-local storage for variables, allowing each thread to maintain its own value. Operates on arbitrary data types through a set of operations for reading, writing, and initializing thread-specific values. Used to manage context or state that must remain isolated between threads, such as logging contexts or database connections.

Allocates and manages thread-local storage slots, allowing retrieval and modification of values specific to the current thread. It provides functions to get values with exceptions, options, or default fallbacks, and to set values directly. Used to maintain per-thread state in concurrent or asynchronous contexts without shared memory conflicts.
